Tak Lagi Terapkan Pemblokiran, Kemenkominfo Bakal Denda Medsos yang Biarkan Konten Negatif
04 Nov 2019, 17:48 by Rayinda Muhammad Ichwan


Tak Lagi Terapkan Pemblokiran, Kemenkominfo Bakal Denda Medsos yang Biarkan Konten Negatif

KBRN, Jakarta: Pemerintah melalui Kemenkominfo memastikan bakal memberlakukan denda bagi penyedia layanan media sosial di Indonesia jika masih memuat konten negatif.
Jejaring sosial seperti Facebook, Twitter, Instagram dan lainnya akan dikenakan denda hingga Rp 500 bila membiarkan adanya konten negatif.
Pasalnya, hingga saat ini masih ada berbagai platform medsos yang terkesan membiarkan masih beredarnya konten pornografi hingga yang bermuatan provokatif.
“Sanskinya akan dituangkan lewat aturan turunan dari PP(Peraturan Pemerintah) Nomor 71 tahun 2019 tentang Penyelenggaraan dan Sistem Transaksi Elektronik,” ujar Dirjen Aplikasi Informatika Kemenkominfo, Samuel Pangerapan, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).
Ia memastikan, PP yang telah disahkan pemerintah pada 10 Oktober lalu itu akan menerapkan sanksinya kepada platform media sosial manapun.
“Kita aktif memantau konten yang bertebaran di dalamnya. Jika ada konten negatif seperti pornografi hingga terorisme, konten tersebut harus segera dihapus dari peredaran,” jelasnya.
Dirinya menegaskan, Kemenkominfo tak akan lagi menerapkan sanksi pemblokiran usai adanya PP tersebut. 
Ia pun mengharapkan, platform medsos juga berperan aktif melakukan penindakan terhadap akun-akun bodong yang menyebarkan konten yang tak positif.
“Kalau kami temukan, di platform itu ada konten negatif, itu akan kami denda. Dendanya juga tidak macam-macam. Mulai dari Rp100 sampai Rp500 juta. Jadi tidak perlu lagi pemblokiran,” tuturnya.

No Longer To Implement Blocking, Ministry of Communication and Information Will Fines Social Media that Allow Negative Content
Nov 04 2019, 17:48 by Rayinda Muhammad Ichwan


No Longer To Implement Blocking, Ministry of Communication and Information Will Fines Social Media that Allow Negative Content

KBRN, Jakarta: The government through the Ministry of Communication and Information ensures that it will impose fines for social media service providers in Indonesia if it still contains negative content.
Social networks such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and others will be fined up to Rp 500 if they allow negative content.
Because, until now there are still various social media platforms that seem to allow the circulation of pornographic content to be provocative.
"The Sanskinya will be poured through a regulation derived from PP (Government Regulation) Number 71 of 2019 concerning the Implementation and Electronic Transaction System," said Director General of Informatics, Ministry of Communication and Information, Samuel Pangerapan, Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019).
He ensured, the PP which was passed by the government on October 10 will apply the sanctions to any social media platform.
"We actively monitor the content that is scattered in it. If there is negative content such as pornography to terrorism, the content must be immediately removed from circulation, "he explained.
He emphasized that the Ministry of Communication and Information will no longer apply the blocking sanctions after the PP is issued.
He also hopes that the social media platform also plays an active role in taking action against bulging accounts that spread non-positive content.
"If we find, on that platform there is negative content, we will be fined. The fine is not all that. Starting from Rp100 to Rp500 million. So there is no need for blocking anymore, "he said.
